subject: Design
title: Memphis Group: Design's Punk Rebellion
description: Learn Memphis Group: Design's Punk Rebellion in one minute.

hook.text: In 1981, Ettore Sottsass made a bookshelf that looked like a totem pole painted by a child. It sold for millions.

buildup.text: The Memphis Group used clashing colors, weird shapes, and cheap laminates to mock 'good taste.'

discovery.text: They argued that modernist purity had become as oppressive as the ornament it replaced.

twist.text: David Bowie was a collector. Karl Lagerfeld furnished his Monaco apartment entirely in Memphis.

climax.text: Memphis lasted only seven years but permanently freed design from the tyranny of minimalism.

punchline.text: Sometimes the most serious design statement is a joke.

quiz.question: What did the Memphis Group rebel against?
